instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1534 820-00244 no boot
threads.message:
Hi, new to the forum and have been reading some of the posts on the A1534 and not feeling good about getting this one. Device had battery changed by another tech and now will not power up. Below are the voltage measurements. PM_SLP_S4_L = 0 which I think is due to PM_RSMRST_L being at 61mv. R7810 resistance measures fine and did not find anything out of the ordinary with diode mode. Tracing back on the schematics I think the issue could be with U7800 but wanted some expert advice on where I might go next to validate. I do not have an Oscope to check clock signals. Thanks in advance.

PPVRTC_G3H = 3.09
PCH_SRTCRST_L = 3.07
PP3V3_S5 = 3.34
PM_DSW_PWRGD = 3.35
PP3V3_SUS = 3.34
PM_BATLOW_L = 3.32
PM_RSMRST_L = 61mv
PM_PWRBTN_L = 3.34
PM_SLP_S4_L = 0

threads.title: A1534 820-00244 no boot
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

What is the exact PPBUS_G3H voltage?
Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L at same time.

PM_RSMRST_L can be pulled down by U7800, SMC, or PCH.
Check PCH_RTCRST_L and PCH_INTRUDER_L.

threads.title: A1534 820-00244 no boot
threads.message:
Thanks for the welcome and the help. 

PPBUS_G3H  = 8.72

PM_PWRBTN_L  dropped to .3 from 3.3 when  PM_PWRBTN_L  triggered

PCH_INTRUDER_L  = 2.57 (seems low to me)
PCH_RTCRST_L  = 3.07
PPVRTC_G3H = 3.08

threads.title: A1534 820-00244 no boot
threads.message:
PCH_INTRUDER_L is good enough.

"when  PM_PWRBTN_L  triggered"
Do you mean SMC_ONOFF_L?
If yes, PCH receives the power button information from SMC, but cannot reply while PM_RSMRST_L is pulled down.
Post diode mode to ground at PM_RSMRST_L with red probe at ground.

threads.title: A1534 820-00244 no boot
threads.message:
sorry, yes I meant SMC_ONOFF_L

PM_RSMRST_L  diode measurement is .415

threads.title: A1534 820-00244 no boot
threads.message:
You can try replacing SMC and U7800.
If PM_RSMRST_L still low, then bad PCH (CPU)...

You should already know the CPU on A1534 board doesn't have long life...

threads.title: A1534 820-00244 no boot
threads.message: Thanks and I have read a lot on here about these CPUs so hoping it is not.

threads.title: A1534 820-00244 no boot
threads.message: Thanks again for all of your help. One more question. Do you know where I can find the ICs? I have been unable to locate them.

threads.title: A1534 820-00244 no boot
threads.message:
SMC MUST be from donor board, same model.
I don't know if U7800 has specific firmware for particular board; maybe not, need to try...
